text:
AWS Glue is a serverless, fully-managed, and
cloud-optimized service for cataloging data and

running extract-transform-load jobs (or "ETL"). 
You simply point AWS Glue to your data stored

on AWS, and AWS Glue discovers your data and
stores the associated metadata (such as table

definition and schema) in the AWS Glue Data Catalog.
Once cataloged, your data is immediately

searchable, queryable, and available for ETL jobs.
Since AWS Glue is serverless, you don't

need to manually provision or manage any infrastructure.
AWS Glue handles provisioning, configuring, and scaling

of the resources required to run your ETL jobs on a
fully-managed and scalable Apache Spark environment.

This means you don’t have cluster resources sitting
idle, and you pay only for the resources used while

your jobs are running. This automatic provisioning of resources
to run your jobs used to take several minutes to begin

work, each time a new job was submitted.
Now, with Glue version 2.0, you can start

your jobs 10 times faster. In addition, AWS Glue
version 2.0 Spark jobs will be billed in one-second

increments, with a 10 times lower minimum billing duration
(from 10 minutes minimum down to 1 minute minimum).

As a result, customers can now run micro-batch,
deadline-sensitive, and interactive workloads

more cost-effectively. To take advantage of these
faster job start times, all you need to do is select

Glue version 2.0 when submitting your job.
Let’s see this in action.

First, I’ll log into the AWS Glue console, create a new job, and submit
a simple PySpark ETL job script using an older version of Glue

Now I’ll speed up time, because it’s going to take
several minutes for the job to start.

OK! The job’s done.
Let’s see how long it took.

Now, let's re-run the same PySpark ETL job, but this time, we’ll
select Glue version 2.0 to run this job.

As you can see, our job starts
executing in only a few seconds!

AWS Glue version 2.0 supports jobs running
on Spark version 2.4.3 which are written

in Python version 3.6,
and it’s available today.
